application.offer

Class Reservation

  • java.lang.Object
    • application.offer.Reservation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Reservation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class that stores all the data needed to book an offer. It uses the classes Offer and Guest, as the are needed to perform the actions of this class
    Author:
    Miguel Arconada (miguel.arconada@estudiante.uam.es) y Alberto Gonzalez (alberto.gonzalezk@estudiante.uam.es)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • payReservation

        public void payReservation()
                    throws NotTheReserverException,
                           es.uam.eps.padsof.telecard.InvalidCardNumberException,
                           CouldNotPayHostException,
                           TimeIsUpException,
                           RestrictedUserException
        Method that pays the reservation. It calls the method payOffer()
        Throws:
        NotTheReserverException - When the user trying to pay is not the reserver
        es.uam.eps.padsof.telecard.InvalidCardNumberException - When the credit card is not valid
        CouldNotPayHostException - When the app could not pay host
        TimeIsUpException - When the five-day period to pay a reservation has passed
        RestrictedUserException - When the user is restricted on this offer
